comment: Dont get much better with sherry than this

[distilled 2012, bottled 2018, 57.8% abv]
Nose: dried fruits, raisins, sweet dark chocolate
Palate: black peppers, rich & sweet molasses, oak wood
Finish: long and dry spice
Sweet, almost too much. Does it come from the Sherry casks or did they add a little something something?
Alchemy. First smell & taste was like a cognac or brandy. An ice cube or two later it became a very drinkable whiskey with subtler tastes and a spicy finish. PFM.

Nose: Dried raisins, vanilla
Palate: Creamy, raisin, some nuts, spicy, hazelnut
Finish: Peppery
**Requires a splash of water to dilute the cask strength and reveal the underlying sweetness
